result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Threat to a Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angelo A. Lehn

records.addlTxt:
Cases called at 2:30 PM: 21CF1231, 21CM798, 21CM827, 21CM908, 22CF10.
Defendant Angelo A. Lehn appeared by video, in custody from the jail, Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared in court for Angelo A. Lehn, Attorney Monica A Fallon appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Counsel indicates the State's offer has recently been revised and the Defendant has not been informed of it.
Attorney Thorson indicates that he can go to the jail to meet with the Defendant right now. Adjourned to 3:45 PM.

Cases re-called at 3:46 PM with the same appearances.  Agreement has been reached. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defendant waives his right to personal appearance.
Defendant waives his right to Preliminary Hearing in 21CF1231. Court accepts the waiver and binds the matter over.
State to file Information. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
21CF1231: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine. 
Sentenced is Withheld and  the  Defendant is placed on 2 Years  of Probation with the following conditions:
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations.  Apply for and if accepted, successfully complete Treatment Court.  
The Defendant will not be penalized if he is not accepted to the Treatment Court. 9 Months of jail with Huber stayed for use of the Treatment Court Team.  
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. AODA and follow through with recommendations.  
Court costs/surcharges, DNA sample/surcharge. Contraband ordered destroyed.
21TR8638: Defendant pleads No Contest to OWI 1st Offense and is sentenced to an $811.50 forfeiture and 6 Month DL Revocation.
Defendant is not granted any sentence credit.
Plea hearing on February 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Conditions: 
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.

(Case called at 11:05 AM- by Zoom)  Defendant Angelo Lehn appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Alicia Linzmeier. District Attorney Peter Rindal appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the Complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived. 
Hearing: 01/20/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
